result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica J. Scoville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was granted 5 days credit for time served.  Prison sentence to start immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution  to be paid out of inmate funds and on a schedule established by the agent when on extended supervision.  Court ordered that Restitution was not to be paid out of the bond.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Paid out of bond
Defendant is to obtain a GED or high school diploma.  Defendant is to maintain full time employment or school or a combination of both.

Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant is to use only one pharmacy, unless authorized by her agent for other pharmacies.  Defendant shall sign all releases for her records to her agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random drug screening as required by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

The defendant shall have no contact with  C.P. R.M. and H.B. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

AMENDED 08/04/2017  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is order to report to the Fairchild Police Dept. if they are able to do randum urine testing, at least 5 times a week.  The defendant shall submit to random urine testing as required by any law enforcement officer.     The defendant shall have no contact with  L.H. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
